title: Quincy Adams Station Entrance at Independence Avenue Reopened
text: On December 3, the walkway leading from Independence Avenue in Quincy to the Red Line’s Quincy Adams Station re-opened, connecting the adjacent neighborhood to faster access to the Station.

title: Fitchburg Train 404 Update
text: Following a derailment incident this morning, normal service is expected through the day.

title: Brighton Avenue Bus Lane Coming Spring 2019
text: Today the MassDOT Board and FMCB received an update on the MassDOT Allston Early Action Transit Study, which included recommended transit improvements and the launch of a Brighton Avenue dedicated bus lane pilot in spring 2019.

title: MassDOT Issues RFP for Lynn Transit Action Plan Study
text: The Lynn Transit Action Plan Study will focus on strategies to enhance the quality, capacity, and reliability of public transportation for residents and local businesses in Lynn, Massachusetts.

title: T launches MBTA.com/Weekend for Upcoming Weekend Work
text: The new page consolidates major work into one, concise location.

title: MBTA Service Plans for Wednesday’s Red Sox Parade
text: To accommodate the 2018 Boston Red Sox World Series victory parade, the MBTA will operate enhanced service on Wednesday. Parade attendees strongly encouraged to purchase round-trip fares in advance.

title: MBTA Launches Perq for Work
text: Perq is the new name of the monthly pass program for companies that want to offer this added benefit to their employees.

title: Shuttle Buses Replacing Green Line D Branch Service between Reservoir and Kenmore for 8 Consecutive Weekends Beginning October 27-28
text: These shuttle bus service weekends allow for work to take place for the Green Line D branch’s Track and Signal Replacement Project, the Fenway Portal Project, and capital construction work between Beaconsfield and Kenmore.

title: Franklin Line Weekend Shuttles during 2 Weekends for East Street Bridge Rehabilitation Work
text: Weekend work for the East Street Bridge Rehabilitation Project will begin Friday on October 19 and November 9 with regular service resuming on Monday morning of October 22 and November 12, respectively.

title: Weekend Daytime Closures of Chelsea Street Drawbridge for Standard Maintenance
text: This drawbridge closure will result in the SL3 and Route 112, which both typically operate over the bridge, to be detoured around the affected area. Delays will likely occur.

title: Work to Improve Reliability of the Fitchburg Commuter Rail Line Continues
text: This tie replacement project is necessary track maintenance to help ensure a smooth and comfortable ride for passengers, and to further improve service reliability.

title: MBTA Announces Retail Concession Opportunities
text: The MBTA will release an Invitation to Bid to lease ten separate retail concession locations, generating non-fare revenue for the MBTA and providing the rare opportunity to lease retail space at some of the MBTA’s most active stations.

title: New Riders’ Transportation Access Group Meeting to Be Held on October 18
text: R-TAG has been established as a new customer advisory group focused on matters related to accessibility for people with disabilities and seniors.

title: On Green Line D-branch, Nighttime Bus Shuttles Run Between Brookline Hills and Reservoir in October
text: In support of Green Line’s Track and Signal Replacement Project, buses will replace Green Line D-branch trolleys between Brookline Hills and Reservoir beginning at 9 p.m. through the end of service October 8-11 and October 14-18.

title: MBTA Awards Signal Upgrade Contract for Red and Orange Lines
text: Once complete, the new signal systems on both lines are expected to substantially improve service reliability and improve peak hour headways.

title: First Extended-range Hybrid Bus Joins the MBTA's Silver Line Fleet
text: New bus features include the next generation of hybrid propulsion systems and "start/stop" technology.

title: MBTA Positive Train Control Project Completes Work on Schedule in Order To Apply for 2020 Extension
text: All PTC work has been completed, all requirements have been satisfied, and the MBTA has submitted to the FRA a Request for Extension for full PTC system deployment to December 2020.

title: MassDOT, MBTA, Keolis, and Transit Police to Partner with Massachusetts Operation Lifesaver to Raise Awareness during Second Annual Rail Safety Week
text: MassDOT, MBTA, Keolis, TPD, and others are participating in educational initiatives during the nation’s second annual Rail Safety Week. Developed by Operation Lifesaver, this year’s Rail Safety Week is September 23-29, 2018.

title: MBTA to Resume Regularly Scheduled Service on the Haverhill Commuter Rail Line
text: The MBTA is resuming regularly scheduled service on the Haverhill Commuter Rail Line beginning Sunday, September 16, making all stops, including stops at Lawrence, Andover, and Ballardvale.

title: Limited Service This Weekend on the Haverhill Commuter Rail Line
text: Train service will operate between Reading and North Station, while express buses will be provided between Haverhill and Reading Station. Neither train nor bus service will be available between North Wilmington and Lawrence Stations.

title: Haverhill Commuter Rail Line Will Continue to Only Operate between North Station and Reading This Evening
text: Due to the continued emergency situation in the Merrimack Valley, passengers bound for Haverhill or Bradford stations should take the Lowell Line to Anderson-Woburn Station to connect with shuttle buses.

title: Commuter Rail Service on Haverhill Line Only Operating Between North Station and Reading
text: This is due to the continued emergency situation in the Merrimack Valley. Busing will be available for passengers at Haverhill and Bradford stations, taking passengers to Anderson-Woburn Station on the Lowell Line.

title: September 17’s Joint FMCB and MassDOT Board Meeting to Begin at 11 AM
text: The joint meeting will begin one hour early due to a large number of agenda items to be discussed. Public comment will also be taken in 2 segments this Monday.

title: MBTA Launches New Platform that Offers Live Updates on Parking Info
text: The new Twitter account provides real-time parking information for garages at Alewife, Beverly, Braintree, Quincy Adams, Route 128, Salem, Wonderland, and Woodland.

title: Special $10 Weekend Commuter Rail Fare Extended through December 9
text: The special $10 weekend fare on the Commuter Rail, which is valid for unlimited travel through all zones on Saturdays and Sundays, will be extended to Sunday, December 9.

title: Stopped-Train Messaging Begins August 28 on MBTA Countdown Clocks
text: When a train has spent 2 minutes longer than predicted in an area of track, customers will see "Stopped X stops away" on Countdown Clocks.

title: MBTA Receives $20 Million Federal Grant for Positive Train Control
text: PTC can automatically reduce a train’s speed or even stop it to avoid a collision or derailment. It will improve safety and reduce human error on the Commuter Rail.

title: MBTA Schedules Public Meetings in Brookline and Newton for the Green Line D Track and Signal Replacement Project
text: Construction is scheduled to begin in October and continue through December 2020.

title: Alewife Garage Update
text: Alewife Garage will resume normal operating hours beginning at 5 AM on Saturday, August 25.

title: Better Bus Project Public Meeting in Chelsea on August 22
text: The Better Bus Project is focused on making improvements to the existing bus network through operational changes and stakeholder partnerships. The public is encouraged to attend the Chelsea public meeting to learn more and share their ideas.
